_comment: getBulkAircraftExportPaged used as an hourly incremental change feed -- a dealer-broker polls every hour on the hour to recompute market dynamics from all aircraft records that changed in that window. actiondate/enddate accept datetime (not just date). Response uses flat prefixed field schema for relationships.

response.responsestatus: SUCCESS: Ac Count: 12 Comp Count: 28 Cont Count: 24 Phone Count: 41 Comp Ref Count: 28 Ac Evt Count: 97 Ac Flt Sum Count: 156

aircraft._schema_note: Owner fields use owr* prefix, Operator = opr*, Chief Pilot = chp*, Exclusive Broker 1/2 = excbrk1*/excbrk2*, Additional 1/2/3 = addl1*/addl2*/addl3*

notes: actiondate / enddate ACCEPT DATETIME with time: '02/26/2026 10:00:00' -- use this for hourly polling windows
CRITICAL: maxpages=0 and currentpage=0 when all results fit in one call -- this is NOT an error. Treat maxpages<=1 as single-page result
responsestatus encodes counts as a summary string: 'SUCCESS: Ac Count: 12 Comp Count: 28 ...' -- parse with split() if you need these counts programmatically
Flat prefixed relationship schema -- completely different from getRegNumber or getRelationships:
owr* = Owner (owrcompid, owrcompanyname, owrfname, owrlname, owrtitle, owremail, owrphone1)
chp* = Chief Pilot (chpcompid, chpfname, chplname, chpemail, ...)
showMaintenance, showAdditionalEquip, showExterior, showInterior -- all false by default; set true only when you need that data (increases response size significantly)
acevents and flightdata are embedded arrays within each aircraft record -- no separate endpoint call needed
datepurchased is YYYYMMDD format (not MM/DD/YYYY) -- be careful when parsing
forsale is 'Y' / 'N' / '' in this endpoint -- different from getAircraftList which uses 'true'/'false' strings
Hourly polling pattern: run every hour, set actiondate=last_run_time, enddate=now -- stores only the delta, not the full fleet
For result sets > 1 page: use getBulkAircraftExportPaged with /{pagesize}/{page} suffix and loop until page >= maxpages
